just LOL

Picked this up a while ago and finally got around to playing it. Kinda like left 4 dead meets battlefield. Like left 4 dead, you and teammates fight crowds of monsters comming at you. There is no safe room to run to, just a pre-set number of waves of enemies.  After each wave is finished you and your teammates run to a shop to purchase/repair your weapons and armor. More teamwork oriented than left 4 dead, as you can only level up one of your perks by healing teammates, and running off will get you killed pretty fast. Like the battlefield games you choose perks, which act like classes. Everyone has access to the same weapons and equipment, but the more you level your perks, the better you get at specific items related to that perk. Graphics are outdated, but good aesthetics and level design help to offset this. Highly recommended.

Played Left 4 Dead and Left 4 Dead 2 and I have to say I like this game more. Many more maps than L4D, though this game lacks a campaign, it is only survival. Good weapons, good graphics, and much more hardcore and realistic than Left 4 Dead. Very fun in Co-Op. Got it for 7 dollars during Steam Summer Sale  :)

L4D = HL2 w/ Zombies + Co-Op

KF = Arena Style FPS Arcade Combat w/ EXP based Lvl Perks and Monetary Equipment managing.

Two similar approaches. Two different games.

If you like Left 4 Dead, you will like this.
If you don't like Lef 4 Dead, maybe you will like this.
If you like headshoting, you will love this game.
Not much is needed to be said, only: "FREAKING AWESOME!"

Really really fun game. Very hard when you first start out. It sometimes laggs but that is do to my slower macbook pro. Overall i recommend this game to anyone that enjoys zombie survival games. Coming from a left 4 dead fan this is a very good game.

The master mechanic Kevin Clamely has created a multitude of insidious demonic creatures to destory the lives of the innocent and weak. You must band together with your brothers and sisters to survive the onslaught that is facing you.

I highly recomend this game to anyone that enjoys enduring countless enemies while testing their survival skills. Grab 5 of your friends and get to work! This city needs your help to eliminate this destructive force that is coming!
Forget about L4D2. This is the real deal!

Killing Floor is definately one of the best coop games that I own. But what makes it stand out for me is the advanced difficulty the game has, but the best is that it isn't unfair at any time. That what kills you in the end most of the time are your own mistakes in your tactics and/or actions, which makes it even better in my opinion.

Also there's a levelup system with perks like sharpshooter (with headshot damage mutlipliers and stuff) or a field medic (with better healing for teammates etc).

By killing Zeds (name of the infected monsters) you get money which you can spend on better equipment or better weapons, which you will need for sure for the last battle against the Patriarch, if you manage to defeat him then you've beaten the map.

But of course there are a lot more maps to play on, but in the end one of the best coop games I've played, that's for sure!

Uhhh, this game is hard, lol very hard, but also a lot of fun, i have enjoyed every minute of playing it, expecially killing Clowns, Monkeys with chainsaws, and Santa with my friends, Tripwire also releases free level expansion packs and holiday events, so the game never gets old

This is one game that i bought on sale a long time ago that i definitely didn't expect to get much out of. Boy was a wrong. So many servers with different types of mods that include more types of guns/mobs/perks & more. Also has a very good community, ppl actually use their mic and work together & know how to have a laugh. The devs also seem to roll out frequent updates on Christmas/halloween e.t.c so there is a reason to come back to it.

I wasn't sure what to think about this one at first. I initially was gonna pass it up, but a friend of mine sent a guest pass my way and I decided to give it a try. By the time I finished my first map, I was more than willing to shell out the money to play this as much as I wanted. Simple concept, but amazingly fun; get this game as a less taxing, less spec hungry alternative to Left 4 Dead. You won't be disappointed with it.

You fight waves of a mad scientist's specimins. This asshole made a lot of them and different kinds. Your characters are all VERY British and hilarious. The more you level up the more badass you get and cheaper equipment. Higher the difficulty and perk level, the more fun it gets. You will die in this game, so if you get frustrated easily, you probably should not buy this game. If you like a great, challenging co-op survival horror game with plenty of maps, characters, and weapons to choose from, this game is for you.

Yes there are DLC's. They are a little pricey, if you really cannot spend the money, just wait for them to go on sale for like a dollar of 50 cents, otherwise, support the tripwire devs! They really do a great job in supporting this game.

Killing Floor is a first-person co-op survival horror, You and up to five other players must obliterate multiple waves of these rabid specimens. One of the best zombie (in this case ZED) killing games, it is a mix of L4D(2) and the COD Nazi Zombies addon to COD 5, but the game does take on a few aspects of its own creating a hierchy of mobs with special abilities that when fused together devestate teams. You cannot survive this game on your own, you need a good solid team with an understanding of combat concepts.
